Pre-Game Insights: Miles Mikolas, a veteran presence on the mound, brings valuable experience to this crucial matchup.
Mikolas' ability to limit walks (24 in 155.2 innings) demonstrates excellent control, which will be crucial against a patient Blue Jays lineup.
Miles Mikolas' pitch mix, featuring a solid fastball and an effective slider, should keep Toronto's hitters off-balance.
The Cardinals' offense, led by the ever-reliable Paul Goldschmidt, has been heating up lately.
Yariel Rodriguez has struggled to find consistency, posting a 1-6 record with a 4.42 ERA.
Rodriguez's high walk rate (34 in 73.1 innings) could spell trouble against a disciplined Cardinals lineup.
Yariel Rodriguez has shown flashes of brilliance this season and is due for a breakout performance.
Rodriguez's recent outing against Atlanta demonstrated his potential, as he pitched six innings giving up one run on two hits with six strikeouts.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and George Springer each driving in key runs.
Miles Mikolas will show flashes of his veteran savvy, but the Blue Jays' home-field advantage and offensive firepower will prove too much for the Cardinals to overcome.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals are fighting to stay in playoff contention and the Blue Jays are struggling, expect St. Louis to come out with urgency and purpose.

The energy of the Rogers Centre crowd could provide the extra boost needed to overcome the Cardinals.
